title: Jenni 'JWoww' Farley files court documents after her contractor arrived 'high at 10 pm'
text:
While her love life may be back on track following a two-week-long split from boyfriend Zack Clayton Carpinello, 24, not the same can be said for her new home renovations.

Jenny 'JWoww' Farley has sued her contractor after he arrived for work while under the influence, according to court documents obtained by TMZ.

The documents allege the Jersey Shore star hired a craftsman, Anthony Dai, to lay tiles in her new home.

Scroll down for video

Unprofessional: Jenni 'JWoww' Farley filed court documents recently against her contractor who arrived to her home 'high at 10 pm' to lay the tiles she wanted

However he failed to arrive for work until 10pm, and then appeared to be 'high'.

The Jersey Shore star added in the documents that the contractor even left his phone and a wet saw behind.

JWoww reportedly dished out a $1,250 check upfront for the contractor for his work, purchasing the tiles herself.

And while she stopped payments immediately due to his failure to get the job done, he had already cashed in the check.

The publication added that the case has now been settled.

Jenni moved into her new New York home in June after putting her home with ex-husband, Roger Mathews, on the market for $1.45 million.
description: While her love life may be back on track following a two-week-long split from boyfriend Zack Clayton Carpinello, 24, not the same can be said for her new home renovations.
